### getMass() {#a54e82eb147b14cb2ce1f556852b83643}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>BlockMass &amp; llvm::BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase::WorkingData::getMass ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get the appropriate mass for a node.

Get appropriate mass for <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>. If <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a> is a loop-header (whose loop has been packaged), returns the mass of its pseudo-node. If it&#39;s a node inside a packaged loop, it returns the loop&#39;s mass.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h/#l00333">333</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getResolvedNode() {#af4cfe26f95b98d5ebfcc8279a0f494d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="BlockNode llvm::BlockFrequencyInfoImplBase::WorkingData::getResolvedNode () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Resolve a node to its representative.

Get the node currently representing <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>, which could be a containing loop.

This function should only be called when distributing mass. As long as there are no irreducible edges to <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>, then it will have complexity O(1) in this context.

In general, the complexity is O(L), where L is the number of loop headers <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a> has been packaged into. Since this method is called in the context of distributing mass, L will be the number of loop headers an early exit edge jumps out of.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h/#l00314">314</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/blockfrequencyinfoimpl-h">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
